intro: Grammatophyllum kinabaluense, commonly known as the Kinabalu ginger, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of Mount Kinabalu in Borneo. It belongs to the family Zingiberaceae, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-orange flowers. Its leaves are broad and sword-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Grammatophyllum kinabaluense is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its mountainous habitat.
